result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney R Bannister was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 10-23-2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Court waives costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DV assessment - due to defendant's inability to pay.
Defendant to pay the DNA surcharge during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so.

Obtain/Maintain employment - if able to do so.
Obtain GED/HSD.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact with R.R.T., A.S-J and her child.
Third party contact for purposes of child visitation as approved by the agent - agent may modify.
Defendant may travel with 3rd party for pickup/dropoff of children - but no direct contact with the victims.

Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
Take all prescribed medication. 
Successfully complete a Parenting class.
Successfully complete an Anger Management program.
Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.

AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Courtney R Bannister

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Courtney R Bannister in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 10-23-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the Court by Rodney R-T, Angie S-J, the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.
COURT ADVISES the defendant she cannot possess firearms.

Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 2 days served.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Court ordered 20 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- Take all prescribed medication
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Successfully complete a Parenting class
- Successfully complete an Anger Management program
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- No contact with R R-T., A S-J and her child.
- Third party contact for purposes of child visitation as approved by the agent - agent may modify
- Defendant may travel with 3rd party for pickup/dropoff of children - but no direct contact with victims
- Obtain/Maintain employment - if able to do so 
- Obtain GED/HSD
- Court waives costs, fees, assesssments and surcharges including the DV assessment - due to defendant's inability to pay
- Defendant to pay the DNA surcharge during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 10-23-2015

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Courtney R Bannister in court with Attorney Adam c Essling.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Courtney R Bannister in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE DALLET.
Case set for deferred prosecution agreement.  Defense has not received a response from ADA Tempelis whether this can be resolved with a DPA.  Court granted request for adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Courtney R Bannister in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rodney R.T., Angie S.J., and G.S.

ADDRESS INFO for Courtney R Bannister
Current: 9200 W. Birch, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 05-22-2015)
Prior: 4752 North 36th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Courtney R Bannister in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Courtney R Bannister in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-02-2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
